Title: Sharḥ Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 6, 36
Description.abstract: Commentary on Bahāʾ al-Dīn al-ʿĀmilī's Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb. On geometry and mathematics. Includes an introduction and diagrams in ten books (chapters).
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 252.

Title: Majmūʿah
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 6, 37
Description.note: This volume contains several minor Persian pieces (correspondence and poetry) in pp. 2-14, listed in DP 660.  None are really "works," although there is a concrete date in one of them (1056 [1646]).  The individual works we have separately logged are nn. 5 and 6 in DP.

Name.author: Ṭurayḥī, Fakhr al-Dīn, 1571 or 2-1674 or 5
Title: Majmaʿ al-baḥrayn wa-maṭlaʿ al-nayyirayn
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 1, 1
Description.abstract: Dictionary of uncommon and rare Arabic vocabulary found in the Qurʾān and Hadīth literature.  Words ordered according to final consonant in root, with subsections ordered according to first consonant in root.  One volume of larger work.  Begins with Bāb al-Dāl, ends with Ghayn.  Copied from the copy of the author's son.
Description.citation: Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī, Dharīʿah ilā taṣānif al-Shīʿah (Al-Najaf: Maṭbaʿat al-Gharrā, 1936-1986), v. 2 (1768), p. 22.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 340.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Arabic language $v Dictionaries $v Early works to 1800|~|Hadith $x Language, style $v Early works to 1800|~|Koran $x Language, style $v Early works to 1800
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Ṭurayḥī, Fakhr al-Dīn, 1571 or 2-1674 or 5
Title: Majmaʿ al-baḥrayn wa-maṭlaʿ al-nayyirayn
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 1, 2
Description.abstract: Dictionary of Qurʾānic terms illustrated by their use in Hadīth literature.  Words ordered according to final consonant in root, with subsections ordered according to first consonant in root.  One volume of larger work.  Contains colophon and addenda. Begins with Kitāb al-Fāʾ, continues to end. Copied from the copy of the author's son. Includes several fawāʾid at the end. Third in volume.
Description.citation: Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī, Dharīʿah ilā taṣānif al-Shīʿah (Al-Najaf: Maṭbaʿat al-Gharrā, 1936-1986), v. 2 (1768), p. 22.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 340.

Title: Ḥāshiyat Sharḥ al-Tahdhīb

Description.abstract: Glosses by an unknown author on ʿAbd Allah Yazdī's Sharḥ al-tahdhīb on Kitāb al-Tahdhīb al-Manṭiq wa al-Kalām (A.H. 960) originally written by al-Taftazānī (d. A.H. 792) in A.H. 789. Includes notes in the margins.

Title: al-Kifāyah fī ʿilm al-iʿrāb
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 3, 11
Description.abstract: A treatise on Arabic grammar following the style and format of al-Zamakhsharī's Kitāb al-Mufaṣṣil.  Some marginal notations.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 331.

Title: Nathr al-laʾālī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 3, 12
Description.abstract: An alphabetical compilation of the sayings of ʿAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, the first Shīʿī Imām, assembled by al-Ṭabarsī. Includes an incomplete Persian translation underneath the Arabic verses. Written in exquisite Arabic and Persian calligraphy.
Description.citation: Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī, Dharīʿah ilā taṣānif al-Shīʿah (Al-Najaf: Maṭbaʿat al-Gharrā, 1936-1986), v. 4 (262), p. 53-4.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 375.

Subject: Logic $v Early works to 1800|~|Knowledge, Theory of $v Early works to 1800|~|Quṭb al-Taḥtānī, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, $d 1294 or 5-1364 or 5. $t Lawāmiʿ al-Asrār |~|Urmawī, Sirāj al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn Abī Bakr, $d 1198-1283. $t Maṭāliʿ al-anwār|~|Philosophy, Islamic $v Early works to 1800
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Jurjānī, ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad, $c al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, $d 1340-1413
Title: al-Ḥāshiyah al-sharīfiyah ʿalá Lawāmiʿ al-asrār fī sharḥ Maṭāliʿ al-anwār
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 3, 14
Description.abstract: A commentary by al-Sayyid al-Sharif al-Jurjānī (d. A.H. 816) on Quṭb al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Rāzī al-Buwayhī’s (d. A.H. 766) commentary on Sirāj al-Dīn Maḥmūd al-Urmawī’s Maṭāliʿ al-Anwār, entitled Lawāmiʿ al-Asrār. On philosophy and logic. The end folios are missing. Includes notes in the margins.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 208.

Name.author: Ibn al-Fāriḍ, ʿUmar ibn ʿAlī, $d 1181 or 2-1235
Name.scribe: ʿAbd al-Ḥayy ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sulaymī al-Ḥanafī al-Dimashqī
Title: al-Mukhtār min shiʿr ibn al-Fāriḍ wa-shuʿarāʾ ākhirīn
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 3, 15
Description.abstract: Includes a preface and a biography of Ibn al-Fārid in the beginning. Contains excerpts of poetry from Ibn al-Fārid and other Arab poets. Includes an addendum called al-Mutafarriqāt minhā al-Qaṣīdah al-Hamziyah.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 224.

Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Tafsīr
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 4, 25
Description.abstract: Seems to be by the same hand as Dānish'pazhūh M26 and lacks beginning and end folios. An abridged exegesis of the Qurʾān, which starts with Surat Ṭāhā and continues until Sūrat al-Aḥqāf. Author is unknown.  DP notes that the approach is ʿirfānī.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 172.

Title: al-Sharḥ al-muṭawwal li-Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 53, 368
Description.abstract: Al-Sharḥ al-muṭawwal is one of two commentaries by Taftazānī, the other being al-Sharḥ al-muqtaṣar, on Jalal al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Qazwīnī’s (d. A.H. 739) Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ, an abridgment of the third section of Sirāj al-Din Yūsuf al-Kākī’s (d. A.H. 626) Miftāḥ al-ulūm on Arabic grammar and morphology, more specifically on bayān and maʿná. Includes notes in the margins.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 385.

Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Majlisī, Muḥammad Bāqir ibn Muḥammad Taqī, $d 1627 or 8-ca. 1699
Title: Ḥilyat al-muttaqīn
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 56, 413
Description.abstract: Fifteen chapters on Shi'ite popular beliefs based on jurisprudence: Ch.1 On the manner of dress. Ch.2 On the wearing of ornaments and jewels. Ch.3 On the etiquette of eating and drinking. Ch.4 On marriage, sexual intercourse with women, and the education of children. Ch.5 On personal hygiene (brushing one's hair and teeth) Ch.6 On perfuming oneself. Ch.7 On bathing. Ch.8 On sleeping. Ch.12 On entering and leaving the house. Ch.14 On riding and walking. Ch.15 On traveling. Composed ca. A.H. 1079.
Description.citation: Munzavī v. 2, pt. 2, p.1599.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 33.

Description.abstract: This is a collection of verses from poets such as ʿUrfī, Bukhārāʾī, Shaykh Bahāʾ al-Dīn and others. The term "qasīdah" appears in the upper left margin of several folios and the manuscript does not contain a colophon. The date A.H. 1122 appears on the top left margin of one of the folios towards the end of the manuscript. Compiler is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 26.

Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Farāhī, Barkhvurdār ibn Maḥmūd, $d 16th cent.
Title: Shamsah va Qahqahah
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 63, 463
Description.abstract: Dānish'pazhūh divides the text into two items. However, upon a close inspection of a published version of the text, the manuscript is the continuous work titled Maḥbūb al-Qulūb. There are several portions of the text missing, because the folios have fallen out. It also appears that the copyist/compiler has either excluded some portions of the text or copied the text from a different version, which would explain some other discrepancies between the manuscript and the publsihed version. Verified with Farahī, Barkhvurdār ibn Maḥmūd. Shamsah va Qahqahah. Tihrān: Intishārāt-i Kitābkhānah-ʾi Bārānī. 1958.
Description.citation: Munzavī v. 2 pt. 1, p.1365.|~|Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī, Dharīʿah ilā taṣānif al-Shīʿah (Al-Najaf: Maṭbaʿat al-Gharrā, 1936-1986), v. 11 (1471), p. 241.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 675.

Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Jung
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 71, 507
Description.abstract: Manuscript contains poems from several authors such as: al-Nūrī, Shaykh Niẓāmī, Hakīm Abu al-Qāsim and Qādir Nūr Isfahānī. There is an excerpt from Javāhir al-tafsīr and there are various anecdotes about several kings, sultans, caliphs and Imams i.e. Harūn al-Rashīd and Imām Riz̤á et al. The date on the work reads A.H. 129. Author is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 27.

Subject: Islamic ethics
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Akhbār
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 74, 532
Description.abstract: Beginning and end are missing. Chapter headings and Arabic quotes are written in red ink. Chapter eleven is the first complete chapter and is titled: Bāb-i yāzdahum: Ḥaqq-i mādar va pidar bar-farzand. Each chapter begins with an isnad, which is then followed by a brief description of the subject and then by supporting anecdotes and narratives. Author is unknown.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Mathematics, Greek $v Early works to 1800|~|Ptolemy, $d 2nd cent. $t Almagest|~|Geometry $v Early works to 1800|~|Astronomy $v Early works to 1800|~|Surfaces $x Areas and volumes $v Early works to 1800|~|Archimedes. $t Dimensio circuli
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.commentator: Nīsābūrī, Niẓām al-Dīn al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad, $d d. 1328 or 9
Title: Tafsīr Taḥrīr al-Mijisṭī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 6, 40
Description.abstract: A commentary on Naṣīr al-Dīn al-Ṭūsī's Taḥrīr al-Mijisṭī, an epitome of Euclid's Almagest on astronomy.  Page 650 describes the work as an autograph of the commentator on astronomy and geometry. Includes diagrams. The last pages (653-655) of the work contain an explanation of the Archimedean determination of surface area, titled Risālah fī Tarbī‘ al-dā’irah, attributed to Ibn Haytham.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 661.
Description.note: See GAL(2), vol. 1, p. 674

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Armenian language $x Rhetoric $v Early works to 1800|~|Astrology $v Early works to 1800|~|Drugs $v Early works to 1800|~|Cosmology $v Early works to 1800
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: [Scientific and medical miscellany]
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 13, 67
Description.abstract: Includes margins, two columns of writing. First some astrological texts with no author, then a portion from a 6th century Armenian rhetorical treatise called the Book of Chries (Pitoyits Girk), then one 13th century treatise on cosmology by the Syrian physician Ishokh in Armenian translation, and finally an alphabetical work on drugs in five languages by the Armenian physician Amirdovlat Amasiatsi, written in the second half of the 15th century. All these major works have been published. On palaeographical grounds it appears that the manuscript was copied in the 17th or 18th century. There is a later colophon which locates the manuscript in New Julfa (Isfahan) in the year 1821.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Arabic poetry
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Majnūn Laylá
Title: Dīwān Majnūn Laylá al-ʿĀmirī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 29, 179
Description.abstract: Reported by Abū Bakr al-Wālabī, this work is one of two popular versions of Qays ibn al-Mulawwaḥ's (more famously known as Majnūn) unrequited love for Laylá. Majnūn's poetry belongs to and typifies the 'Udhrī genre developed during the 1st century A.H. in the Arabian peninsula. The poetry is framed by prose narrative. A modern edition has been published with the title Dīwān Majnūn Laylá / sharaḥahu wa-ḍabaṭahu wa-qaddama la-hu Muḥammad ʿAlī Shams al-Dīn (Beirut, 2001).
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 225.

Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 277.

Description.abstract: A commentary on Muḥammad ʿAlī ibn Muḅārakshāh's Sharḥ Ḥikmat al-ʿAyn, which is a commentary on Bukhārī's commentary entitled Sharḥ al-Tahdhīb on Taftazānī's Tahdhīb al-Manṭiq wa al-Kalām. On the soul and theory of knowledge. Includes marginal notes.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 200-01.

Description.abstract: Verified in the Harvard catalog. The work is a translation of and tafsīr on the Qurʾān in verse [masnavī]. Rubrics of Qurʾān chapters and key verses are given. The name Ṣafī appears in the third line of the poem and 1251 A.H. is given as date of birth for the author/poet.

Title: Muṣībat'nāmah
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 43, 265
Description.abstract: Written in mas̱navī form. In the margin of the first page the date A.H. 135 (perhaps A.H. 1035) and the names of the purchaser, Bahāʾ al-Dīn Mūsavī, and seller, Ākhūnd Mullā ʿAlī Mīrzā-yi Muʾazzin, appear. The purchase price was in the amount of ten mann (40-84 lbs.) of wheat. Beginning and end folios are missing. Manuscript contains rubrics.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 81.

Title: Tafṣīl-i ʿasākir-i fīrūzī maʾās̱ir-i Shāh Sulṭān Ḥusayn Ṣafavī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 48, 322
Description.abstract: The end of this manuscript contains a translation, into English, of Tuḥfah-ʾi shāhī. This work is a history and description of the various tribes living across the Iranian plateau in 1128 A.H. during the reign of Shāh Sulṭān Ḥusayn Ṣafavī. Author is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 21.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: تفصيل عساکر فيروزی مآثر شاه سلطان حسين صفوی

Description.abstract: *The above note is incorrect; I have left it untouched because I don't know where it came from.  This volume is actually a Majmūʿah, DP 703f.  Delicate condition.  Several pages of scrap-notes between the two works, with some geometric/astronomical proofs.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 703f.
Description.note: Persian translation of Quran. It begins with the Quran's verses about Christianity. There is no formal beginning and the book is in poor condition.  Arabic sections of the book exist.  Condition is very bad->further examination necessary.

DP lists 4 works, but I've reduced to two actual works and two "notices;" after (1) comes a one page "copying of the handwriting" (Naskhat al-khaṭṭ) of Imām ʿAlī b. al-Ḥussayn. Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Proverbs, Arabic
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Kitāb al-amthāl
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 126, 1017
Description.abstract: Anthology of proverbs, in alphabetical order, with marginal notes in Latin.  DP 705f lists this as a Majmūʿah, with a separate set of amthāl-i turkī and of amthāl Luqmān al-Ḥakīm; I see no reason to list these as separate works, since this is essentially an anthology.  Alphabetical order proceeds for first half of volume; then further proverbs are added, beginning with "alef" but not covering the entire alphabet: these were apparently left-overs added by the same hand later.  The proverbs attributed to (or concerning) Luqmān do not amount to an additional work.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 705f.

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 126, 1023
Description.abstract: Title is Dānishpazhūh's suggestion.  These are Shi'a ḥadīth arranged according to numbers mentioned in the body of the ḥadīth: the beginning is missing, so the first entries concern "threes," and the last entries concern "sevens," e.g. a proscription against selling seven sheep.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 145.

Subject: Ṭūsī, Nasīr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, $d 1201-1274. $t Tadhkirah fī ʿilm al-hayʾah|~|Astronomy $v Early works to 1800
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Khafrī, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, $d fl. 1526
Title: Takmilah fī sharḥ al-Tadhkirah
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 127, 1026
Description.abstract: This is an important astronomical treatise by Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad b. Aḥmad al-Khafrī al-Kāshī (d. c. 1525 CE), ostensibly a commentary on Naṣīr al-Dīn al-Ṭūsī's "Tadhkirah fī ʿilm al-hayʾah." Al-Khafrī's work etc. is attested and evaluated in numerous studies by G. Saliba, especially in Journal for the History of Astronomy 25 (1994): 15–38.  The present work is extant only in a few mss; this particular ms may be significant.  Includes some mathematical diagrams. Ending missing.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 177.

Alternate Title.spine: Tape on spine: D 1258, A. Khafri, "Thaskareh," (Re Thusi)

Title: Zubdat al-Maʿārif
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 128, 1034
Description.abstract: The first half of this ms is a Persian treatise on Shīʿite ethics, principles, beliefs (Zubdat al-Maʿārif).  See Dharīʿah 12.32.  Ending missing.The second half is in Arabic and appears to be a substantial fragment of a biography of the prophet Muhammad. Beginning and ending missing.  This section is not mentioned by Dānishpazhūh although it is longer than the first section.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 53.

Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 343.

Title: Maʿālim al-uṣūl
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 134, 1071
Description.abstract: This is the major Usuli fiqh handbook by Shaykh Ḥasan b. Zayn al-Dīn al-ʿAmilī al-Jubaʿī, the son of Shahīd al-Thānī.  Extensive marginal notation.  Six pages of the Qur'an including part of surat al-balad, are inserted at the end on small blue paper.  A pious poem is written on the final page of the manuscript.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 359.

Description.abstract: Begins with a table of contents, pp. 5-15.   Treatise on Shi'a imams and their qualities.   See Brockelmann, S I 589, for information on the authenticity of this work.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 168.

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 135, 1089
Description.abstract: This is a manual for Quranic recitation, arranged in a grid (jadwal) with notes on rumūz and lots of rubrics.  Dānish-pazhūh attributes to Najm b. Saʿd b. Sulaymān.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 371.

Name.author: Zamakhsharī, Maḥmūd ibn ʿUmar, $d 1075-1144
Title: Kashshāf
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 137, 1110
Description.abstract: A Qurʾān commentary; Al-Zamak̲h̲s̲h̲arī's  efforts in explaining the Holy Book's grammatical, lexicographical and rhetorical features, variant readings and the miraculous nature (iʿd̲j̲āz [q.v.]) of its beautiful language. He did so adducing quotations from a wide variety of early prose texts, including the tafsīr of the grammarian al-Zad̲j̲d̲j̲ād̲j̲ [q.v.] and poetry, rather than relying on traditional exegesis.DP 326
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 326.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: Kashshāf ʿan ḥaqāʾiq al-tanzīl|~|الكشاف|~|الكشاف عن حقائق التنزيل

Title: Nahr al-rabīʿ
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 139, 1127
Description.abstract: A treatise on narratives - Arabic literature, erotic literature, sexual behavior, sex customs, love stories. Includes some stories from Suyuti's (ca. A.H. 14th c.?) Nawadir al-ayk fi ma'rifat al-nayk. The beginning is missing.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 236.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: نهرالربيع|~|Nawadir al-ayk fi ma'rifat al-nayk. $t Selections
Description.note: (Note by DB)  DP 236 refers to this work as Zahr al-rabīʿ, listing the author as Sayyid Niʿmat-Allāh al-Jazāʾirī (d. 1701 CE), with reference to Dharīʿah 12.69.  This work already had data entered; "nahr" may be incorrect.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Persian literature|~|Persian poetry
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Nashāṭ, ʿAbd al-Vahhāb, $d 1761 or 2-1828 or 9
Name.scribe: Gīlānī, Ḥasan ibn ʿAlī ibn Niʿmat Allah ibn Husayn
Title: Ganjīnah
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 113, 869
Description.abstract: It appears that this manuscript may be the oldest copy of the complete work known to date (manuscript 740 is an older copy than this one, however, it is incomplete) based on the preface of a published version of this text: ʿAbd al-Vahāb, Nashāṭ Mīrzā. Ganjīnah. ed. Husayn Nakhaʿī. Tehran: Gul Ārā 1379/2000, which is in Harvard Library's possession. The editor, Nakhaʿī, states in the preface that he used a number of manuscripts in his publication and all except one with no date are dated several years later than this manuscript. The text is divided into several sections: the first few sections of the text are collections of various poems and categorized by the different poetic forms such as: the ghazal, rubāʿī and mas̲navī. Other sections contain copies of letters from Shāhanshāh Fatḥ ʿAlī Shāh to Napoleon and other heads of state and the correspondence between Nashāṭ and others. The beginning of the manuscript appears to be missing.
Description.citation: Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī, Dharīʿah ilā taṣānif al-Shīʿah (Al-Najaf: Maṭbaʿat al-Gharrā, 1936-1986), v. 18 (241), p. 248.|~|Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 73.

Title: Maqāmāt-i Ḥamīdī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 113, 870
Description.abstract: Text is written in prose with poetry interspersed throughout the text. First forty-four folios are bordered in gold. Arabic is written in Naskh script. On the first folio, the date 24, Rāmaz̤ān 1293 appears. Manuscript is incomplete.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 83.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Natural history|~|Islam $x Doctrines
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: ʿUṣūl-i dīn va ʿulūm-i ṭabīʿat
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 113, 871
Description.abstract: The text first begins with a description of the natural world followed by a description of the different types of animals and their related habitats, predators and prey and a treatment of the necessity and essentiality of the natural elements. The physiology of the human body and the functions and necessity of each part of the body are described followed by a discussion on the necessity of the necessary being. The remaining chapters are on theology. Beginning and end are missing. Author is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 5.

Title: Qiṣaṣ-i Rabghūzī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 153, 1258
Description.abstract: DP 449, mislabeled "B1258." [Which would cause some confusion, considering the importance of the ms.]  This is a very important (Middle) Turkish ms of the famous stories of the prophets by *AU (LOC auth) Rabghuziĭ, Nosiruddin Burḣonuddin, 13th/14th cent.  According to EI, there are only five such mss extant before the 18th Century (CE).  No cover; in a cardboard container.  Very beautiful. 9th C. AH (DP)
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 449.

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 154, 1263
Description.abstract: *The previous note was in this record before I examined the ms.  DP 89.  DP attributes to *(No LOC Auth) Khwājah ʿUthmān b. Ḥājjī Āqā Bulā-yi Tabrīzī.  There is a five-page sermon at the end of this ms attributed to the author mentioned in the Note above.  The main text is apparently a Sufi treatise inspired by Ahmad Ghazali.  Paper binding.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 89.

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 166, 1396
Description.abstract: Text on horses, divided into two parts. The first treatise consists of narratives related about the Prophet Muḥammad and what he considered to be the best kinds of horses based on various traits. The second treatise is equestrian arts, how to care for and train horses. The last folio contains a prayer in Arabic.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: فرس نامه تحفه پادشاهان و بزرگان صاحبان  اسبان و شناختن علّت و دوای آن

Subject: Arabic poetry
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Majnūn Laylá
Title: Dīwān Majnūn Laylá al-ʿĀmirī
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 168, 1414
Description.abstract: Reported by Abū Bakr al-Wālibī, this work is one of two popular versions of Qays ibn al-Mulawwaḥ's (Majnūn) unrequited love for Laylá. Majnūn's poetry belongs to and typifies the 'Udhrī genre developed during the 1st century A.H. in the Arabian penisula. The poetry is framed by prose narrative. A modern edition has been published with the title Dīwān Majnūn Laylá / sharaḥahu wa-ḍabaṭahu wa-qaddama la-hu Muḥammad  ʿAlī Shams al-Dīn (Beirut, 2001).
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 225.

Name.author: Masʿūdī, Muḥammad ibn Masʿūd, $d 12th cent.
Title: Jahān-i dānish
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 168,  1419
Description.abstract: This is the Persian translation of "al-Kifāya fi ʿilm al-hayʾat al-alām" translated by the author himself. This book consists of two discourses. The first one concerns planets, their shapes and forms; firmaments and their positions; stars and their relations with the planet Earth. The second essay concerns the Earth, both the inhibited and uninhibited regions.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 31.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: جهان دانش|~|ترجمة کفایة فی علم الهية
Description.stamp: The flyleaf includes an ownership stamp, but due to its intricate calligraphy, it is hard to identify the name of the owner.

Title: Kitāb al-Jafr
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 169, 1431
Description.abstract: Compiler unknown.  A book for divination: essentially a book-length table of letters/numbers for divination.
Description.note: Dānishpazhūh dates manuscript as 12th C. AH.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Sharḥ-i Madkhal-i manẓūm
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 169, 1432
Description.abstract: Commentary on the verse treatise on astrology by ʿAbd al-Jabbār al-Khujandī.  DP suggests *AU Ḥabībullāh b. Muḥammad Ṭabīb (not in LOC).

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Nafḥāt al-ghuyūb l-arbāb al-qulūb
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 169, 1433
Description.abstract: Treatise on traditions from the Prophet's family.  In 12 chapters.  *DP gives AU (cannot find any matches) as Shaykh ʿAlī b. Ḥusayn Karbalāʾī.
Description.note: Dānishpazhūh dates manuscript as 12th C. AH.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 169, 1434
Description.abstract: Persian translation of selected treatises of the Ikhwan al-Safa.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Title: Jawāhir-nāmah
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 169,  1435
Description.abstract: Treatise on precious stones.  DP gives *AU (corroborated by Corbin, History of Islamic Philosophy) as Ṣadr al-Dīn Muḥammad b. Manṣūr Dashtakī, i.e. the grandson of the famous philosopher, d. 1554, a.k.a. Amīr Ṣadr al-Dīn II.  (cannot find in LOC)
Description.note: Dānishpazhūh dates manuscript as 11th C. AH.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Astronomy
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. $b Library Special Collections
Name.author: Shūshtarī, Ḥasan
Title: Nujūm
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 170,1447
Description.abstract: First two folios are illuminated. Work contains tables bordered in gold, red and green ink. Using the astronomical tables (zīj) of Muḥammad Shāh, Shūshtarī predicts a lunar eclipse on Thursday the 14th of Muḥarram 1277 A.H.(August 2nd 1860 A.D.). In the year 1860 A.D. a total eclipse of the sun was observed on July 18th and a lunar eclipse was observed on February 7th.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1039 AH), p. 53.
